result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sarah M Hilleshiem is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order Denying - Defense Motion To Dismiss the Entirety of the Information (As to Count 1 - Based on the Good Samaritan Law).
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 10/30/14.

Leslie Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Sarah M Hilleshiem in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Reisha Mitchell.   
Motion filed by Atty. Mitchell - To Dismiss the Entirety of the Information (As to Count 1 - Based on the Good Samaritan Law)

Atty. Mitchell presented arguments to the court.
State presented arguments to the court.
Responses and replies presented.

Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
The statute is very specific as to the charges that are immune from prosecution and is not ambiguous.
This violation is not immune from prosecution .
Therefore, Court Denies - Motion to Dismiss (Based on the Good Samaritan Law)

Defendant Sarah M Hilleshiem in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Atty. Morin makes a Motion to modify bail. State objects to any modification. Court denies any bail modification.  Bail remains as fixed. Preliminary Hearing requested within 10 days.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with alleged victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Sarah M Hilleshiem in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
